intro: Ochthocosmus senensis var. latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf senensis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
